posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
This build drew it's inspiration from not one but two of Mick's builds, i am referring to the " Feat Master " and the " Brawler Champion " of course.

I wanted a party-tank that can really stand his ground and take full-force the enemy's blows without even flinching and repay them with his own devastating blows. I said i wanted a party-tank because if i wanted a soloing-tank i would rather prefer something with rogue inside like my " Dwarven Warmaster ", but once you have someone to buff you, then monk is the better choice and that's why it is here. Strong, very strong saves, rock-solid hit-points, a carapace able to shrug-off most lesser blows, good ac that becomes even better with the use of his myriad combat feats and full evasive capabilities from monk will keep this Dwarf alive and kicking long after everyone else is down to the ground. And this build sacrifices nothing in terms of playability to achieve that, solid from the beginning to the end with no gaps, no thrills, just pure combat value that goes on and on... Have fun!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
This is a very solid build. This character won't flinch if a brute swings his axe or a necromancer wails like a banshee!

My old Feat master build started out as an experiment to see what could be done with all the feats a fighter gets during leveling up. I soon swapped  some fighter levels for CoT 10 for the free bonus to saves without losing any feats. I realized that fighters get enough combat bonus feats to let you ignore combat feats on the general feats completely. That  allows one to add feats that improve saves, skills, stats and other things. With the lvl 20 build Brawler champion I introduced a couple of monk levels for free cleave and evasion and to get tumble as a class skill. Pre epic monk also bolsters the saves with all three F/W/R as primary saves.

You have taken 10 levels of monk here and take 8 of them pre epic and the remaining levels for epic skill dumps. You get cleave and improved knockdown pre epic from monk, and later you get improved evasion. You pick feats that improve saves and hitpoints pre epic and strength during epic levels. 8 pre epic levels of monk help improve the saves all over and leaves room for 9 epic bonus combat feats from CoT and fighter.
You manage to get str 30 and con 22 with EDR 9/-. You have dev crit and all relevant combat feats for bastard sword including all AB enhancing feats. You get Armor skin, and even Improved expertise.
The saves are extraordinary. The hitpoints are high. You get a tank that can shrug off both physical and magical attacks, and withstand severe damage when hit.

If you ignore EDR , and if you take less monk, preferably all in epic levels, then this build can get +4AB and reach +46. That will give more devastating critical hits and generally a more aggressive warrior. But you know how to make such characters, and I know that is not your goal here. If I should add a tweak or two, it would be to keep expetise, but forget about Improved expertise, since that will drop your AB to +32. If you also drop WP exotic, you can afford the disarm feats. I am tempted to ignore the trap skills and take spot or a cross classed taunt instead.

You have taken my builds one step further and succeeded in building a very solid party tank that can sustain some serious hardship and still be dangerous enough to attract the attention away from more fragile party members.

posts.author: campgod
posts.content: Just a Newb question from me...If I use full plate with a shield I lose the AC bonus from the monk right? So I guess my question is, Is it better to wear the full plate with a shield or robes with the AC from the monk? I do not know how to calculate it. Ty.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
From the Wiki,

" A monk's UBAB, armour class bonuses (from wisdom and every 5 levels), and speed are all negated when the monk wears armor other than clothing or uses a shield "

Monk serves other purpose in this build, it is not here for his AC bonuses (except from tumble of course). For example Monk gives from his 1st. level both evasion and cleave plus a very nice +2 to all your saves. He also allows you to use monk gear such as the famous sun soul boots. The way this build is made you are far better with a plate mail and a shield, Monk here simulates the sixth sense of this Dwarven Hero which allows him to survive intact on the battlefield even in situations that would have dire consequences to him (improved evasion, full tumble ranks for more ac, better saves, e.t.c)

posts.content: I see, gotcha. Thank you. This toon looks fun to play in the CTF(PvP) on my server where there would be people buffing him up.
